item.title: Microsoft Agent Framework - Creating Microsoft Foundry Agents
item.description:
In an earlier article, we looked at a brief introduction to the Microsoft Agent Framework. This framework combines the best parts of AutoGen and Semantic Kernel into a unified framework for building enterprise and production-ready AI agents. It supports various agent types, including Microsoft Foundry Agents. All agent types inherit from the common base class AIAgent to provide a consistent interface.

The Foundry agents are created using AzureAIAgentClient. Let us start with an example.
